item.title: Cell Towers At Schools: Godsend Or God-Awful?
item.description: July 14, 2017 - School districts are making deals with telecom companies to build towers on school property. The agreements give schools a bump in revenue, but what do parents think? And what does the science say?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 14, 2017 - School districts are making deals with telecom companies to build towers on school property. The agreements give schools a bump in revenue, but what do parents think? And what does the science say? http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/07/14/535403513/cell-towers-at-schools-godsend-or-god-awful

item.title: Computer Scientists Demonstrate The Potential For Faking Video
item.description: July 14, 2017 - Fake news articles may just be the tip of the iceberg. New research — which manipulates footage of former President Obama — shows it's possible to create fake news videos too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 14, 2017 - Fake news articles may just be the tip of the iceberg. New research — which manipulates footage of former President Obama — shows it's possible to create fake news videos too. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/14/537154304/computer-scientists-demonstrate-the-potential-for-faking-video

item.title: Afghan Girls Robotics Team Allowed To Enter U.S. For Competition
item.description: July 13, 2017 - President Trump intervened to find a way to permit the girls entry after their applications for visas were twice rejected. For the budding scientists, the path to compete has been a long one.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 13, 2017 - President Trump intervened to find a way to permit the girls entry after their applications for visas were twice rejected. For the budding scientists, the path to compete has been a long one. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/13/537050073/afghan-girls-robotics-team-allowed-to-enter-u-s-for-competition

item.title: Mobile App Designed To Prevent Pregnancy Gets EU Approval
item.description: July 13, 2017 - For the first time, a medically approved birth control app has been certified as a method of contraception. It relies on math, an algorithm and a woman's body temperature to determine fertility.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 13, 2017 - For the first time, a medically approved birth control app has been certified as a method of contraception. It relies on math, an algorithm and a woman's body temperature to determine fertility. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/13/536974741/mobile-app-designed-to-prevent-pregnancy-gets-e-u-approval

item.title: Internet Companies Plan Day Of Action In Support Of Net Neutrality
item.description: July 12, 2017 - Major tech companies, small websites and many others are making their case Wednesday in support of an open Internet. Most are protesting plans by the Federal Communications Commission to undo net neutrality, or open Internet, rules.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 12, 2017 - Major tech companies, small websites and many others are making their case Wednesday in support of an open Internet. Most are protesting plans by the Federal Communications Commission to undo net neutrality, or open Internet, rules. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/12/536887872/internet-companies-plan-day-of-action-in-support-of-net-neutrality

item.title: Lawsuit Says It's Unconstitutional For President Trump To Block Critics On Twitter
item.description: July 12, 2017 - "The White House is transforming a public forum into an echo chamber," says an attorney at the Knight First Amendment Institute.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 12, 2017 - "The White House is transforming a public forum into an echo chamber," says an attorney at the Knight First Amendment Institute. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/12/536842197/lawsuit-says-its-unconstitutional-for-president-trump-to-block-critics-on-twitte

item.title: The Hello Girls: America's First Women Soldiers And Their Fight For Recognition
item.description: July 12, 2017 - The women of the U.S. Army Signal Corps were heroes in World War I. But when they returned home, they soon learned that the government that had recruited them for this mission didn't even consider them veterans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 12, 2017 - The women of the U.S. Army Signal Corps were heroes in World War I. But when they returned home, they soon learned that the government that had recruited them for this mission didn't even consider them veterans. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-12/americas-first-women-soldiers-had-to-fight-for-recognition-as-veterans

item.title: Why The Internet Fast Lane Has Bypassed Rural America
item.description:
July 12, 2017 - Broadband access for more than 23 million rural Americans is lousy.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-12/why-the-internet-fast-lane-has-bypassed-rural-america
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 12, 2017 - Broadband access for more than 23 million rural Americans is lousy. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-12/why-the-internet-fast-lane-has-bypassed-rural-america

item.title: Documents Show Backpage.com Controls Sex-Related Ads
item.description: July 11, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Washington Post reporter Tom Jackman about the discovery of new documents showing that Backpage.com, a website with classified ads, controls sex-related ads on its site. The company has claimed it does not control the ads people post.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Washington Post reporter Tom Jackman about the discovery of new documents showing that Backpage.com, a website with classified ads, controls sex-related ads on its site. The company has claimed it does not control the ads people post. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/11/536699811/documents-show-backpage-com-controls-sex-related-ads

item.title: A Novelist Forces Himself To Press On After Losing 100 Pages In A Tech Glitch
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Mat Johnson's recent hard-drive failure wasn't the first time he experienced data loss. This time, despite losing more work than ever before, he's less panicked: "I can write new words," he says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Mat Johnson's recent hard-drive failure wasn't the first time he experienced data loss. This time, despite losing more work than ever before, he's less panicked: "I can write new words," he says. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/534865245/a-novelist-forces-himself-to-press-on-after-losing-100-pages-in-a-tech-glitch

item.title: Anti-Social: Why Disagreements Turn Into Death Threats Online
item.description:
July 11, 2017 - The Internet is not a safe space to express opinions.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-11/anti-social-why-disagreements-turn-into-death-threats-online
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Internet Companies Plan Online Campaign To Keep Net Neutrality Rules
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Dozens of websites — including large ones like Netflix, Facebook and Amazon — join an online advocacy push Wednesday, urging regulators and lawmakers not to weaken regulations for Internet providers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Dozens of websites — including large ones like Netflix, Facebook and Amazon — join an online advocacy push Wednesday, urging regulators and lawmakers not to weaken regulations for Internet providers. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/535804285/internet-companies-plan-online-campaign-to-keep-net-neutrality-rules

item.title: Author: Governments Seek To Dominate The 'Wild West' Of Cyberspace
item.description: July 11, 2017 - In The Darkening Web, Alexander Klimburg warns that the threat of an international cyber war is as real as nuclear exchange during the Cold War — only "many orders of magnitude greater."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - In The Darkening Web, Alexander Klimburg warns that the threat of an international cyber war is as real as nuclear exchange during the Cold War — only "many orders of magnitude greater." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/11/536595548/author-governments-seek-to-dominate-the-wild-west-of-cyberspace

item.title: Some Employers Are Rethinking Telework, Citing A Need For Better Collaboration
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Some companies find that real-time technology demands have forced them to curb their work-from-home policies, even as a growing number of employers continue to embrace remote work.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Some companies find that real-time technology demands have forced them to curb their work-from-home policies, even as a growing number of employers continue to embrace remote work. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/535398716/some-employers-are-rethinking-telework-citing-a-need-for-better-collaboration

item.title: Microsoft Courts Rural America, And Politicians, With High-Speed Internet
item.description: July 11, 2017 - In rural America, 23.4 million people do not have high-speed Internet. Microsoft plans to change that, in an effort that uses cheap technology and appeals to the lowest common denominator in politics.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - In rural America, 23.4 million people do not have high-speed Internet. Microsoft plans to change that, in an effort that uses cheap technology and appeals to the lowest common denominator in politics. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/536559534/microsoft-courts-rural-america-and-politicians-with-high-speed-internet
